===Overview===
The '''Federal Bureau of Investigation''' ('''FBI'''), is the domestic intelligence and security service of the [[United States of America]]. Based out of [[Washington, D.C.]] it is the countries principal federal law enforcement agency. 

====Origin====
It was founded by [[John Edgar Hoover (Earth-616)|J. Edgar Hoover]] he also served as it's director. He was credited with building the FBI into a one of the world top crime-fighting agencies.{{r|Daring Mystery Comics Vol 1 3}}

====Prohibition====
In the 1930's Hoover congratulated [[Dale Sturm (Earth-616)|Dale Sturm]] one of his top FBI agents when he tracked down and arrested [[Timothy Hersberger (Earth-616)|Red Corker]].{{r|Daring Mystery Comics Vol 1 3}}

Also in the 1930s, an informer told the FBI about bootlegger [[Dutch Mallone]], who lived in a house later belonging to [[Benjamin Parker (Earth-616)|Ben]] and [[Maybelle Parker (Earth-616)|May Parker]]. FBI sent a force led by Eliot Ness, who captured Mallone and prosecuted him for tax evasion.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 1 200}}

====[[World War II]]====
When a [[Nazi]] U-Boat learned of a troop ship leaving [[New York]] Harbor they sank the vessel. The FBI suspected they had a Nazi spy in their midst and wonder how the spy is able to smuggle information out of a secured office. Hoover called the Angel to assist in ferreting out the spy. He does and Hoover thanked him for his assistance.{{r|Mystic Comics Vol 2 2}} 

Hoover called in the [[Jim Hammond (Earth-616)|Human Torch]]  and [[Thomas Raymond (Earth-616)|Toro]] to assist in the investigation of Colonel Carson's disappearance, which the FBI suspects was likely the work of Nazi spies.{{r|All Select Comics Vol 1 10}}

In 1941, the Director of the FBI during the development of the [[Super-Soldier Serum]] was [[J. Arthur Grover (Earth-616)|J. Arthur Grover]].{{r|Captain America Comics #1}}

In 1942, Agents of the F.B.I. enlisted the aid of [[Steven Rogers (Earth-616)|Steve Rogers]] and [[James Buchanan Barnes (Earth-616)|Bucky]] to stop the threat of the [[Master Man]]. This incident led to the creation of the [[Invaders (WWII) (Earth-616)|Invaders]].{{r|Giant-Size Invaders Vol 1 1}}

In 1944 at FBI headquarters, the [[All-Winners Squad]] were abriefed about an operation to steal one of America's atomic bombs. Hoover sent the heroes race to [[Nevada (State)|Nevada]] to protect the bomb{{r|Sensational She-Hulk Vol 1 22}}

====[[Cold War (Event)|Cold War]]====
In 1958, the [[Agents of Atlas (Earth-616)|Agents of Atlas]] rushed to save [[Cary Dekum (Earth-616)|Kit Sekum]], but the Air Force didn't get the message in time and the plane was destroyed. J. Edgar Hoover took a personal interest in the case, sending the two canisters with [[Captain America]] and [[Bucky]] in them back to the archives and confiscating the red triangles. When Agent [[James Woo (Earth-616)|Jimmy Woo]] asked if Hoover trusts them, Hoover decided that their team has outlived its usefulness. [[Department Zero (Earth-616)|Department Zero]] is no more.{{r|Agents of Atlas Vol 2 4}}

====Death of Hoover====
Hoover remained director until his death in 1972.

=== Modern Era ===
The FBI were investigating a string of robberies of entire towns that left its residents like statues. They eventually discovered that this was due to the [[Maynard Tiboldt (Earth-616)|Ringmaster]] and his [[Circus of Crime (Earth-616)|Circus of Crime]] and arrested the group just after their run-in with the [[Bruce Banner (Earth-616)|Hulk]].{{r|Incredible Hulk #3}}

Two unnamed agents were assisted by [[Iron Man (Tony Stark)|Iron Man]] in capturing a group of Soviet spies.{{r|Tales of Suspense Vol 1 42}}

[[Justin Pierce (Earth-616)|Justin Pierce]] is a member of the FBI's Metahuman Crimes Division.{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 14}}
